Plot Decision Tree from Policy Tree Results

margot_plot_decision_tree.Rd

This function creates a ggplot object displaying a decision tree based on the results of a policy tree model.

Usage

margot_plot_decision_tree(
  batch_model_output,
  model_name,
  x_padding = 0.25,
  y_padding = 0.25,
  border_size = 1,
  edge_label_hjust_true = 1.5,
  edge_label_hjust_false = -0.5,
  span_ratio = 0.35,
  text_size = 5,
  node_distance_adjustment = -1.5,
  leaf_fill = "lightgreen",
  non_leaf_fill = "lightyellow",
  title = NULL
)

Arguments

batch_model_output

A list containing the results from a policy tree model.

model_name

A character string specifying the name of the model within the batch_model_output to plot. This should match one of the model names in batch_model_output$results.

x_padding

The amount of padding to add to the x-axis. Default is 0.25.

y_padding

The amount of padding to add to the y-axis. Default is 0.25.

border_size

The size of the border around node labels. Default is 1.

edge_label_hjust_true

Horizontal justification for "True" edge labels. Default is 1.5.

edge_label_hjust_false

Horizontal justification for "False" edge labels. Default is -0.5.

span_ratio

The aspect ratio of the plot. Default is 0.35.

text_size

The size of the text in the node labels. Default is 5.

node_distance_adjustment

The adjustment for spacing between nodes. Default is -1.5.

leaf_fill

The fill color for leaf nodes. Default is "lightgreen".

non_leaf_fill

The fill color for non-leaf nodes. Default is "lightyellow".

title

The title for the plot. Set to "none" for no title. Default is NULL.

Value

A ggplot object representing the decision tree for the specified model.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Assuming result_psychological_well_being is the batch model output
margot_plot_decision_tree(result_psychological_well_being, "model_t2_hlth_fatigue_z")
} # }
